alert.note: Alert for Moniteau (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 04 at 8:41PM CDT until August 04 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Moniteau County in central Missouri... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 841 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Tipton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Tipton around 845 PM CDT. Clarksburg around 850 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include California. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
